content.description: Stand(higher) start to Mexican Hat Dance, easier but so good! Start with your right hand on the sharp cornered crimp, and left on the lowest obvious hold to the left. Heel hook your way through bumps and mantle straight over the apex.
content.protection: A few pads and a good spotter.
content.location: Skips the first few moves of Mexican Hat Dance for an easier but still crazy fun variation.

climbs.name: Mexican Hat Dance
climbs.fa: Liam Wynn & Owen Dao(split FA) - Feb 8th 2020

content.description: Fantastic low ball problem with good holds throughout. Very fun! Sit start low to the right with left hand on a sharp corner and right hand on a lower right sloper/dish, either get a high right heel to pull off the ground or throw feet in front of you on a lower shelf thatâ€™s far away but positive. Follow the Arete up to the apex of the boulder and mantle directly up. There is a stand start that goes about V2- that starts with left hand out on the lowest obvious hold. Stand start removes 3-4 hard moves low.
content.protection: A few pads and a good spotter.
content.location: Just uphill(maybe 300 feet) from the furthest north-western loop of the campground. Faces west/northwest. Coordinates are approximately 33. 13.31 N 116. 27.24 W.
